children.text: There are steel reinforcement bars visible on the edge of the slab, which are exposed to weather and starting to rust. This will continue to do so over time, and can possibly lead to the future cracking of the slab as well as its possible long-term failure.
It is a requirement of section 5.3.2 Reinforcement of AS 2870 Residential Slabs and Footings, that
‘Reinforcement in rafts and slabs shall be placed with minimum concrete cover of the reinforcement shall be 40 mm to unprotected ground and 40 mm to external exposure’ .
The builder must properly cut back and treat these areas prior to back-filling to ensure the long-term performance of this slab.
